185913070.review:
Grey Goo is an episodic RTS base-builder with 3 factions. The gameplay changes depending on which faction you are playing, with the campaign serving as an in-depth look at the capabilities and special 'epic' units of each faction.

The gameplay is fun and interesting, and the story is a classic tale of military intrigue and conflict born from misunderstanding. The cutscenes are highly polished, and the voice acting is superb, with different factions featuring different arrays of accents.

185746089.review:
Una lastima que no haya tenido exito.

Lo estoy rejugando ahora y a pesar de sus muchos problemas la diversidad y diferencia entre facciones es muy buena, cada una funciona muy diferente.

Pero las unidades de por si y la estetica (de las unidades, las estructuras estan bien) se siente muy generica.

Ahora por fin tras 15 años, voy a probar la expansion, y justo me di cuenta de que la expansion da totalmente una nueva faccion, aun no la he probado pero por lo que he leido es otro estilo completamente original.

Otra parte quizas buena quizas mala dependiendo de tus gustos, es el hecho de que al parecer gastaron mucho presupuesto en los graficos cgi y escenas de dialogo entre misiones. A mi personalmente me hubiese gustado mas menos dinero ahi pero mas original.

En resumen: Juego genial, que quizas te tienen que forzar en las primeras misiones dado que el argumento parece generico pero hay un twist y mejora muchisimo personalmente.

PROS:
-Gran variedad entre facciones (Cada una funciona completamente distinta)
-Graficos (Para tener 10años el juego aun luce muy bien)
-Originalidad en la idea de la historia

Cons:
-Casi todas las unidades se ven aburridas y/o muy pequeñas para el detalle.
-Historia empieza muy floja, realmente muy floja.
-Comunidad para partidas online inexistente (aunque la campaña da mucho contenido que disfrutar)

Para mi el juego ha valido la pena, y ojala hubiese tenido exito, me gustaria RTS mas parecidos con mas diferencia entre facciones.

185100556.review: 画质完美  玩法新颖

184579921.review:
Heads up: This campaign does not have an ending and will likely never.

The best parts of this game are the cut scenes they saved for the trailer. The game is very very slow played leaving you waiting for units to get to their location or finish killing an enemy. This can sometimes take minutes. The repetitive strategy of artillery mixed with cheap units will get you through almost every level of the very short campaign.
The story is not very well written and completely lacks a real end.

The best part of this game is the actual mechanics of the Grey Goo faction itself. Which is a shame as it gets bogged down by everything else.

I really wanted to like this game but sadly it plays like a time sink with little reward.

184220753.review:
came so close to being good...

Just needed less of the budget spent on acting and more on levels units and maps...

But its a classic style rts so that's something

183556799.review: Underrated in my opinion. The game has very cool factions concepts and the feeling when playing is diffrent from other RTSs. The game has more focus on macro and loosing army 5 times in short time doesn't mean you will loose. However the game practicly doesn't have any players.
